newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to Watch - Jan 3.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to Watch - Jan 3.

text.p: -- Bank of New York Co Inc said it is seeking approval to double its stake in State Street Boston Corp to 9.9 percent. The request looks like the beginning of a courtship that could lead to a full-scale takeover bid, analysts and arbitragers said.
State Street shares closed at 62-7/8 Thursday, off 1-5/8.

-- Abbott Laboratories has settled with the U.S. Federal Trade Commission over charges by the regulatory agency regarding advertising of Abbott's Ensure beverage, the Wall Street Journal reported. Shares closed off 3/8 at 50-3/8.
-- United Dominion Industries agreed to sell its Bredel unit for about $30 million. Shares closed at 23-1/2 on the New York Stock Exchange.
-- Mitek Systems Inc said it expects a first quarter loss of $0.03 a share due to a revenue shortfall. Shares closed at 1-13/16.
-- FileNet Corp said it expects fourth quarter earnings of $0.20 a share, down from $0.32 a year ago. It cited delayed orders by customers. Shares closed at 31-3/4.
-- ACX Technologies said it expects a fourth quarter charge of $15-$25 million. Shares closed at 19-7/8.
